stepTitle: You are walking to a bus stop at a right-angle corner. You move north at a rate of $$2$$ $$\frac{m}{sec}$$ and are $$20$$ $$m$$ south of the intersection. The bus travels west at a rate of $$10$$ $$\frac{m}{sec}$$ away from the intersection - you have missed the bus!
stepBody: What is the rate at which the angle between you and the bus is changing when you are $$20$$ $$m$$ south of the intersection and the bus is $$10$$ $$m$$ west of the intersection?
